title: Trump Campaign Downplays Impact of Criminal Trials on 2024 Bid
description: Republican frontrunner Donald Trump’s campaign downplayed the impact criminal cases will have on his White House bid, insisting voters would see the prosecutions as politically motivated.

title: White House Tells Agencies to Prep for Shutdown Amid House Chaos
description: The White House on Friday notified several agencies to prepare for a possible government shutdown with House Republicans divided in Congress over a spending deal.

title: Trump Judge Says He’ll Hold Hearing on Fani Willis Affair Claims
description: The judge overseeing the Georgia election fraud indictment of Donald Trump said he will hold a hearing in February on explosive claims that prosecutor Fani Willis improperly appointed a romantic partner to lead the investigation, overpaid him and took vacations with him.

title: NRA Paid Ex-CFO $30,000 a Month for Consulting After He Retired
description: The National Rifle Association’s longtime chief financial officer told a New York jury he was paid $30,000 a month after his retirement for consulting services to the gun-rights group, which the state alleges had squandered millions of dollars in donated cash.

title: How the US and UK Came to Attack the Houthis
description: President Joe Biden was vacationing in St. Croix on the morning of Jan. 1 when he convened a meeting of his national security team. Pressure had been building for weeks for military action against Iran-backed Houthi militants for their persistent attacks on shipping in the Red Sea.

title: Government Shutdown Chances Decrease as Risks to Johnson Rise
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Hunter Biden Reverses Stance, Offering to Testify in Private
description: Hunter Biden abruptly reversed his defiance of House Republican impeachment investigators, offering to testify before them privately after insisting he would only answer their questions in public.

title: Taiwan Picks New Leader in Election Closely Watched by World
description: Taiwanese voters are heading to the polls in an election that will determine their island’s relationship with Washington and Beijing for years to come, and impact regional security.

title: Biden Says Austin Erred But Still Has Faith in Pentagon Chief
description: President Joe Biden said he retained confidence in Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin following a flap where the Pentagon chief failed for days to inform the White House he had been hospitalized.

title: Biden Thinks Houthis Should Be Considered Terrorist Group
description: US President Joe Biden said he believes Yemen-based Houthi rebels that have attacked Red Sea shipping are a terrorist group.

title: US and Allies Brace for Houthi Retaliation Against Airstrikes
description: Houthi rebels vowed to target US and UK commercial vessels a day after the allies launched airstrikes against the group in Yemen, fanning concern that the Israel-Gaza war is blossoming into the regional conflict that the Biden administration feared.

title: Poland’s Tusk Says He Will Seek Ways to Probe Central Bank Chief
description: Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk said there are ways to investigate central bank Governor Adam Glapinski and described a recent court ruling that bars lawmakers from probing him as “not binding.”

title: Why Ecuador Is Erupting With Narco Gang Violence
description: Ecuador’s intensifying war with narcotics gangs spilled into the open in January. In just a few days, two notorious drug lords escaped from jail, uprisings broke out in multiple prisons in which inmates took guards as hostages, and a TV station was overrun by masked gunmen in a scene that was broadcast live. The mayhem highlighted Ecuador’s rapid descent from tranquil tourist destination to war zone — and one of the most dangerous places in the world.

title: Five Turkish Troops Killed, Eight Wounded in North Iraq Attack
description: Five Turkish soldiers were killed and eight others wounded in an attack by Kurdish separatists in northern Iraq, the government in Ankara said late Friday.

title: Homeless Camp Clash With City Draws US Supreme Court Review
description: People clear a homeless encampment in February 15.

title: Coldest Weather Ever During Iowa Caucus Threatens Trump’s Lead
description: Donald Trump is yearning for a blowout victory in Monday’s Iowa Republican caucus as Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis aim to get close enough to the frontrunner to prolong their 2024 presidential bids.

title: Biden to Cancel More Student Loan Debt in Latest Round of Relief
description: President Joe Biden’s administration will cancel a fresh batch of student loan debt for some borrowers, his latest effort after the Supreme Court blocked his flagship proposal to offer billions in relief.

title: Houthi-Fired Missile Narrowly Misses Hitting Russian Oil Carrier
description: A ship hauling Russian oil had a narrow miss with a missile fired from Yemen, as vessels increasingly dodge the Red Sea following airstrikes on Houthi rebels.

title: White House Slams Texas Governor for Blocking Border Agents
description: The Biden administration said Texas is preventing federal agents from processing migrants from Mexico by blocking access to a municipal park in the border town of Eagle Pass.

title: Trump Wins Dismissal of 2018 Lawsuit Over Video Phone Promotions
description: With one trial down and another starting next week, former President Donald Trump quietly eked out a courtroom victory in a low-profile lawsuit that’s been grinding away for more than five years.

title: Oregon Supreme Court Declines to Hear Trump Ballot Challenge
description: The Oregon Supreme Court declined to hear a challenge seeking to keep Donald Trump off of the Republican primary and general election ballots.

title: Blinken Meets Top Chinese Official on Cusp of Taiwan Elections
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with a top Chinese foreign-policy official on Friday, as their nations work to reestablish contacts that had been severed as tensions rose in recent years.

title: Votes for Haley Mean Votes for Trump, DeSantis Campaign Says
description: Ron DeSantis’ campaign delivered one of its starkest critiques yet of Republican rival Nikki Haley days before the Iowa caucus, saying her spending on advertisements attacking the Florida governor were motivated by “greed” and have only boosted former president Donald Trump.

title: Trudeau’s Main Rival Pledges to Tie Immigration Levels to Homebuilding
description: The Conservative politician who’s trying to take down Justin Trudeau said that if he’s elected, he would link Canada’s immigration levels to the number of homes being built.

title: Top DeSantis Aide Sees Arctic Blast Helping His Campaign Odds
description: Ron DeSantis’ campaign is banking that their early strategy to build a robust ground game in Iowa will help them even as frigid weather calls into question voter turnout in Monday’s first-in-the-nation Republican caucus.

title: How Iran’s ‘Axis of Resistance’ Is Widening Mideast Conflict
description: As the war between Israel and the Islamist Palestinian group Hamas has continued, it’s stoked violence in other parts of the Middle East. Militant groups backed by Iran, which supports Hamas and for years has engaged in a shadow war with Israel, have joined in. These groups — part of Iran’s so-called axis of resistance — have attacked Israeli targets, ships in the Red Sea, and US forces, provoking retaliation. The clashes raise concerns that a wider conflagration will engulf the region.

title: UN Guard Killed in Second Somali Militant Group Attack This Week
description: The United Nations said a member of its guard unit was killed in a mortar attack on the organization’s compound in Somalia’s capital on Thursday.

title: Speaker Johnson Defies GOP Hardliners, Stands By Spending Deal
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson defied a rebellion on his right flank and said Friday he will stick with a spending deal he made with Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, decreasing the risk of a government shutdown.

title: Polish Central Banker Flags Tightening If Price Caps Lapse
description: Poland’s central bank may consider raising interest rates or even start unwinding its bond purchases if the new government allows for the current inflation-curbing measures to expire in this first half of this year, according to Monetary Policy Council member Ireneusz Dabrowski.

title: Poland Kicks Off Rule-of-Law Reform With New Rules for Judiciary
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s government introduced legislation aimed at reforming a mechanism to select judges, a first step in the new pro-European administration’s bid to restore the independence of the judiciary.

title: Poland’s Political Drama Echoes Trump Election Loss Aftermath
description: The twists of recent days have highlighted the task facing the new government as it tries to undo its nationalist predecessor’s grip on the state.

title: Houthis Vow to Respond After US, UK Launch Air Strikes in Yemen
description: The US and UK launched about 70 airstrikes on Houthi targets in Yemen in an effort to stop shipping attacks in the Red Sea, though the Iran-backed group pledged to retaliate with an urgent response.

title: The Iowa Caucuses Are More Important Than Ever, Thanks to Trump
description: The first-in-the-nation contest will make or break presidential campaigns.

title: Houthi-US Showdown Is a Watershed Moment for Iran’s ‘Axis of Resistance’
description: The airstrikes meant to cow Yemen’s Houthi militants are pitting the US and its allies against an Iran-backed movement that senses its moment has arrived after seizing on the Israel-Hamas war three months ago.

title: Noboa Seeks Tax Increase in Equador to Finance War on Drug Cartels
description: Ecuador’s President Daniel Noboa is seeking to raise taxes to shore up the government’s teetering finances after declaring war on the drug gangs terrorizing the country. Bonds rallied.

title: Airstrikes Launched: The UK Response to Red Sea Aggression
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: South Africa’s Ruling ANC Says Welfare-Grant Extension Non-Negotiable
description: South Africa’s ruling African National Congress, which is gearing up to contest elections later this year, said the extension of a monthly welfare grant is non-negotiable and the required funding must be allocated in the February budget.

title: Norway Plans to Criminalize Harmful Foreign Influence Operations
description: Norway’s government proposed that it should be a criminal offense to help foreign powers influence decision making or public opinion that could harm the Nordic country’s national security.

title: China’s Military Vows No Tolerance in Crackdown on Corruption
description: China reiterated it has zero tolerance for corruption within its military, and will put key personnel under closer scrutiny, as the country deepens its push to stamp out graft across critical sectors.

title: Finland Seizes Men Illegally Entering From Russia Through Forest
description: Finnish border guards arrested a group of men who illegally crossed the closed Russian frontier through the forest, suggesting worsening tension on the NATO’s newest demarcation with its key adversary.

title: Nawaz Sharif Gains Ground on Imran Khan Ahead of Pakistan Polls
description: With less than a month to go before Pakistan’s elections, jailed ex-prime minister Imran Khan remains the most popular politician, although his rival Nawaz Sharif has gained considerable ground since returning from self-exile last year.

title: US Agrees Preliminary Deal With Africa on Extending Trade-Access
description: The US has reached preliminary agreement with African nations to extend their preferential trade access by another decade, pending approval by Congress, South Africa’s trade minister said.

title: Israel Rejects South Africa’s Genocide Allegations at UN Court
description: Israel rejected allegations of genocide at the United Nations’ court, arguing its operations in Gaza are a legitimate defense against the largest calculated mass murder of Jews in a single day since the Holocaust.

title: Pro-Biden Super PAC Plans $140 Million Blitz of Anti-Trump Ads
description: The Democratic super political action committee American Bridge 21st Century plans to spend $140 million on advertising in the 2024 presidential race with a message targeting Donald Trump on issues including abortion and democracy in battleground states.

title: The Spreading Fallout From the Israel-Hamas War
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Vietnam’s Communist Party Chief Hospitalized After Falling Ill
description: Vietnam Communist Party chief Nguyen Phu Trong has been hospitalized after becoming ill, with the party’s central committee canceling a meeting this week, according to multiple officials with knowledge of the matter.

title: Brent Oil Hits $80 After Airstrikes Target Yemen’s Houthis
description: Oil jumped as the US and its allies launched airstrikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen, retaliating for attacks on ships in the Red Sea that have imperiled flows of fuel and goods through the vital waterway.

title: Thiel’s Palantir, Israel Agree Strategic Partnership for Battle Tech
description: Palantir Technologies Inc., the data analysis firm that provides militaries with artificial intelligence models, has agreed to a strategic partnership with the Israeli Defense Ministry to supply technology to help the country’s war effort.

title: US, India to Discuss Visas, Tariffs During Tai’s New Delhi Visit
description: US Trade Representative Katherine Tai is on a three-day visit to India where she’s expected to hold talks with the country’s trade and foreign ministers on topics including business visas for Indian workers and duty-free access on goods.

title: Trump’s Lofty Iowa Expectations Set High Bar for Big Victory
description: The only problem with being the Republican presidential frontrunner in 2024 is that voters expect a blowout victory.

title: Russia Prepares Legal Battle to Stall Seizure of Frozen Reserves
description: Russia is devising a legal challenge to snarl any efforts by the US or Europe to confiscate some of its $300 billion in frozen central bank assets in favor of Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: US Tanker Cancels Plan to Move Military Fuel to Philippines
description: A US tanker has canceled a plan to transfer a fuel shipment from a naval facility in Hawaii to a former US military base in the Philippines due to the lack of a diplomatic clearance from Manila, an issue that a Philippine lawmaker had linked to tensions over Taiwan.

title: China Central Bank Seen as Open, Pragmatic in Economist Meeting
description: The new leadership at China’s central bank signaled an openness to finding workable solutions to economic problems at a recent meeting with experts, according to one attendee.

title: Shipping Advised to Avoid Key Global Trade Way Point After Airstrikes
description: The Combined Maritime Forces advised merchant ships to temporarily avoid the Bab el-Mandeb shipping strait for the time being after the bombing of Houthi targets in Yemen overnight, according to an industry notice seen by Bloomberg.

title: Myanmar’s Junta Says It Reached Cease-Fire Deal With Rebels
description: Myanmar’s junta said it reached a temporary cease-fire agreement with rebels after talks backed by China, potentially ending more than two months of fighting.

title: Sunak Pledges Ukraine Funding, Security Guarantee in Kyiv Visit
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said the UK would increase military funding for Ukraine by some £200 million ($260 million) to £2.5 billion, in a show of commitment to Kyiv as military action in the Middle East draws the world’s attention.

title: New Philippine Finance Chief to Push Tax Bills, More Revenue
description: Philippine Finance Secretary Ralph Recto pledged to focus on boosting tax collection and sustaining current spending as he took over the job on Friday in the first revamp of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s economic team since he assumed power in 2022.

title: Vietnam Set to Expand Graft Probe Into Misuse of Key Energy Fund
description: Vietnam is preparing to widen a probe into alleged corruption among officials connected to the energy sector as the Southeast Asian country seeks to gain control over a worsening power crisis, according to officials with knowledge of the matter.

title: North Korea Set to Allow First Tourist Visit in About Four Years
description: North Korea is set to allow the first group of tourists to visit the country since it shut its borders at the start of the pandemic in 2020, in a sign of opening that could be followed by a soccer match against Japan’s national women’s team.

title: Taiwan Presidential Contender Calls US Most ‘Important Ally’
description: The wild card candidate in Taiwan’s presidential election called the US the island’s top partner, and pledged to sustain ties with Washington if he wins.

title: Rishi Sunak Travels to Ukraine With Multi-Billion Package of Military Aid
description: Rishi Sunak is making a surprise visit to Ukraine to meet Volodymyr Zelensky, as the UK announced it will provide £2.5 billion in military aid to the country over the coming year.

title: China Chooses Successor to Retiring Climate Envoy Xie Zhenhua
description: China’s long-time climate envoy Xie Zhenhua has officially retired and will be replaced by one of the country’s top diplomats, Liu Zhenmin, state-run CCTV reported Friday.

title: Oil’s Red Sea Pinch Point Could Get Tighter After US Airstrikes
description: A major drop in shipments of oil and fuel through the Red Sea could become even bigger due to the risk Houthi rebels will retaliate following the US-led attacks on their bases in Yemen.

title: What the US-led Airstrikes on Yemen Likely Mean for Oil Prices
description: The US and its allies launched airstrikes on over a dozen Houthi targets in Yemen, in retaliation for a spate of attacks on merchant vessels in the Red Sea.

title: Biden Backs Far-Reaching Yemen Strikes Despite Fear of Wider War
description: President Joe Biden faces the biggest test yet of his ability to avert a wider war in the Middle East following US-led air strikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen aimed at halting their campaign of attacks on shipping traffic in the Red Sea.

title: China Urges Papua New Guinea to Protect Its Citizens After Riots
description: China urged Papua New Guinea to take “swift and effective measures” to protect its citizens after businesses owned by Chinese expatriates were looted in deadly riots across the Pacific nation in recent days.

title: Taiwan Doesn’t Expect Big China Military Drills Right After Vote
description: Taiwan doesn’t expect China to carry out large military drills around the island immediately after the election but sees Beijing ramping up economic pressure and taking other coercive measures before the new president takes office in May.

title: One of These Three Men Will Be Taiwan’s Next President
description: Taiwan’s presidential election Saturday will be the first big test of democracy in a year of pivotal elections globally, deciding the leader of the biggest geopolitical flashpoint between China and the US.

title: The Taiwanese Soldier Who Fought and Died Defending Ukraine
description: Parallels with the threat from China spurred Jonathan Tseng to join the fight in Ukraine. The Big Take podcast retraces his tragic journey.

title: Argentina to Issue 20,000 Peso Bills as Inflation Eclipses 211%
description: Argentina is preparing to offer larger denomination peso bills in an attempt to simplify daily transactions that require some in the country to carry backpacks stuffed with cash.

title: US Sending General, Top State Department Officials to Ecuador
description: The US will send top military, State Department and law enforcement officials to Ecuador to offer assistance as that country battles a terror campaign launched by powerful narco gangs.

title: Who Are the Houthis Being Hit With US, UK Military Airstrikes?
description: The US and UK launched airstrikes on Houthi rebel targets in Yemen in response to the group’s attacks on ships in the Red Sea for almost two months. The war between Israel and the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas has drawn in the Houthi rebels, who have controlled northwestern Yemen for nearly a decade. Like Hamas, the Houthis are hostile to Israel and backed by Iran. The rebels have said they’re targeting Israel-linked vessels, though ships with no such direct connection have been affected. The

title: US and Japan Conclude Search in Fatal Osprey Plane Crash
description: The US and Japan finished a search, rescue and salvage operation for an Osprey military aircraft and its eight airmen who died when it crashed off a Japanese island, prompting the Pentagon to ground its fleet of the tilt-rotor planes.

title: US, UK Launch Airstrikes on Houthi Targets in Yemen
description: INTERNATIONAL WATERS RED SEA, YEMEN - NOVEMBER 20: This handout screen grab captured from a video shows Yemen's Houthi fighters' takeover of the Galaxy Leader Cargo in the Red Sea coast off Hudaydah, on November 20, 2023 Photographer: Handout/Getty Images Europe

title: Trump’s NY Civil Trial Finale Was Latest Chance to Steal Spotlight
description: The Thursday finale of New York’s $370 million civil fraud trial against Donald Trump provided the former president and Republican frontrunner with his latest opportunity to steal the spotlight.
